message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.SE, cs.SY, cs.DC

The paper discusses security in the context of the Internet of Things, which is a topic that falls under the computer science sub-category of "cs.CR" (Cryptography and Security). Additionally, the paper specifically surveys existing literature on security in RFID and WSN, which are both sub-fields of networking and communication, falling under the sub-category of "cs.NI" (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses the need for a model of security in the IoT, which is a topic that falls under the sub-category of "cs.SE" (Software Engineering). Furthermore, the paper discusses the potential attack surfaces and vectors that may arise from the unification of Intranets of Things, which is a topic that falls under the sub-category of "cs.SY" (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper discusses the pre-existing research that IoT descends from, which is a topic that falls under the sub-category of "cs.DC" (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing).
